description: Your one-stop interface to browse Malaysia's wealth of open data. This page will consistently grow in depth and breadth with high-quality data from federal and state agencies in Malaysia. In the early stages, we will incrementally release data in a controlled manner rather than a data dump.
description_agency: Your one-stop interface to browse {{ agency }}'s wealth of open data. This page will consistently will grow in depth and breadth, providing richer and more varied data from {{ agency }}.
description_opendosm: Your one-stop interface to browse our wealth of open data. This page will consistently grow in depth and breadth, providing richer and more varied data from the various divisions of DOSM.

vector.title: Vector Graphic (SVG)
vector.desc: Suitable for high quality prints or further image editing.

csv.title: Full Dataset (CSV)
csv.desc: Recommended for individuals seeking an Excel-friendly format.

parquet.title: Full Dataset (Parquet)
parquet.desc: Recommended for data scientists seeking to work with data via code.

geojson.title: GeoJSON (JSON)
geojson.desc: Open standard format for plotting geographical features on maps.

header_2: What caveats I should bear in mind when using this data?
code_desc: Connect directly to the data with Python.

code_comments.geojson_1:
# the first URL gives you 15dp accuracy (highest possible) 
# the _LIGHT URL gives you 5dp accuracy, sufficient for visuals but not analysis 
# the _LIGHT URL is over 90% smaller in size, hence the tradeoff
code_comments.geojson_2: # Uncomment below to maintain a rectangular map, but remove the whitespace caused by the South China Sea
code_comments.geojson_3: # Uncomment below to change from rectangular --> square, for a more compact visual

sample_query.unavailable: This data catalog is not available through OpenAPI as the nature of the data makes it unsuitable for API access. For the full dataset, please use the provided download link as shown in the above section.
